item.title: Priyanka Gandhi demands answers from PM Narendra Modi over falling value of rupee, reminds of his attacks on UPA - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Priyanka Gandhi demands answers from PM Narendra Modi over falling value of rupee, reminds of his attacks on UPA

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized the current government for the rupee reaching its lowest value against the US dollar, demanding accountability from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

  • The rupee declined 18 paise to settle at 86.04 against the US dollar.
  • Priyanka recalled PM Modi's past statements during UPA's tenure linking rupee value with government prestige.
  • She emphasized that Modi should explain the current situation to the public.
  • Contributing factors include global crude oil prices and foreign funds outflow.
"Today he himself is the prime minister and all the records on the fall of the rupee have been broken. He should answer to the people of the country," Priyanka Gandhi stated.

This situation emphasizes the need for the government to respond effectively to economic challenges amidst changing global dynamics.

item.title: Mumps outbreak triggers school closure and heightened surveillance in Alappuzha - The Hindu
item.description:
Mumps Outbreak Leads to School Closures and Increased Surveillance in Alappuzha

Published on: January 11, 2025 06:32 pm IST

The Health department has ramped up surveillance and preventive measures due to a mumps outbreak in Alappuzha, resulting in the closure of two schools for 21 days.

  • Two schools closed: Government NS Lower Primary School and Government Lower Primary School.
  • 23 students from Eramalloor school and 9 from Perumbalam South have tested positive.
  • Previous closure due to 33 positive cases at another school last month.
  • Precautionary measures are being implemented in collaboration with local bodies.
  • K.C. Venugopal, MP, requests government action for testing and awareness programs.
“Despite being a vaccine-preventable disease, mumps was not included in the Universal Immunisation Programme.” - K.C. Venugopal

The mumps virus can lead to serious complications if untreated, and health officials encourage the public to seek medical advice for symptoms.

item.title: Amit Shah hits back at Arvind Kejriwal: 'Can he declare BJP's CM face?' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amit Shah hits back at Arvind Kejriwal: 'Can he declare BJP's CM face?'

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Amit Shah criticized Arvind Kejriwal over his prediction regarding the BJP's chief ministerial candidate for Delhi. He emphasized that the BJP is focused on delivering welfare to the people, rather than making false promises.

  • Shah questioned Kejriwal's ability to declare a CM face ahead of elections.
  • He asserted that only the BJP can genuinely benefit the people of Delhi.
  • The BJP's election manifesto is promised to address the real problems faced by citizens, particularly slum dwellers.
  • Shah claimed that under BJP, significant infrastructure like the Ram Temple has been prioritized.
"Congress and 'AAP-da' cannot benefit the people of Delhi. Only the BJP can benefit them... They are making promises every day just for the sake of the vote bank."

The upcoming Delhi assembly election is scheduled for February 5, with results to be announced on February 8.

item.title: Delhi polls: Arvind Kejriwal claims BJP's CM face will be Ramesh Bidhuri; Amit Shah reacts - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi polls: Arvind Kejriwal claims BJP's CM face will be Ramesh Bidhuri; Amit Shah reacts

Publication Date: Saturday

Source: Times of India

Aam Aadmi Party leader Arvind Kejriwal announced that the Bharatiya Janata Party has selected Ramesh Bidhuri as its chief ministerial candidate for the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.

  • Kejriwal suggests a public debate between Bidhuri and other candidates to discuss their visions for Delhi.
  • Amit Shah questioned the legitimacy of Kejriwal's announcement.
  • Kejriwal asserts that he is the declared CM face for his party.
  • BJP leaders state that the CM candidate will be announced by party leadership at the appropriate time.
“There must be a public debate between BJP’s CM candidate and other parties including us.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The political landscape in Delhi is heating up as both parties prepare for the upcoming elections, with Kejriwal challenging the BJP's selections and urging transparency in candidate decisions.

item.title: How wildfires are wreaking havoc in Los Angeles: An interactive guide, map - Hindustan Times
item.description:
How Wildfires are Wreaking Havoc in Los Angeles: An Interactive Guide

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The California wildfires that erupted on January 7, driven by Santa Ana winds, have devastated Los Angeles, destroying thousands of structures and forcing over 100,000 residents to evacuate.

  • Over 36,000 acres burned, with significant destruction in Pacific Palisades.
  • At least 11 confirmed fatalities with the toll expected to rise.
  • 10,000 buildings destroyed and damage estimated at $150 billion.
  • Hollywood celebrities among those affected by the fires.
“Our city has completely let us down.” - LA Resident

The wildfires highlight the increasing severity of fire threats in California and expose challenges in emergency response amid extreme weather conditions.

item.title: Laxmi Dental IPO: OrbiMed-backed ₹698-crore IPO mobilises ₹314 crore from anchor investors ahead of subscription | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Laxmi Dental IPO: OrbiMed-backed ₹698-crore IPO mobilises ₹314 crore from anchor investors ahead of subscription

Date & Source: January 2023, Live Mint

OrbiMed-backed Laxmi Dental has raised ₹314 crore from anchor investors prior to its initial public offering (IPO) which opens for subscription on January 13.

The initial share sale will conclude on January 15, with shares priced between ₹407-428.

  • Laxmi Dental allocated 73.39 lakh shares to 31 entities at ₹428 each.
  • The IPO includes a fresh issue of equity shares worth up to ₹138 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) worth ₹560 crore.
  • The company's shares will be listed on the BSE and NSE.
  • Proceeds from the fresh issue will be used to repay debt, fund capital expenditures, and invest in its subsidiary.
“Laxmi Dental is an end-to-end integrated dental products company with a comprehensive portfolio.”

The Laxmi Dental IPO is significant as it taps into the growing demand for dental products and is backed by strong investor interest from various entities.

item.title: Game Changer box office collection day 2 (updated live): Ram Charan-Shankar film to beat Indian 2 lifetime? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Game Changer box office collection day 2 (updated live): Shankar's Ram Charan, Kiara Advani-starrer seems to fare better than his Kamal Haasan-starrer.

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The film Game Changer, featuring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, has performed better than expected, earning ₹15.47 crore on its second day.

  • Released on January 10, Game Changer collected a total of ₹66.47 crore by the end of its second day.
  • It had a lower occupancy rate compared to other language versions, with a peak of 36.09% in the evening.
  • Game Changer is projected to compete with other upcoming Sankranthi releases for audience attention.
Shankar’s previous film, Indian 2, collected ₹25.6 crore on its opening day.

In conclusion, while Game Changer has made a strong debut, it faces significant competition from other films released during the festive season.

item.title: Allu Arjun Gets BIG Relief In Fan's Death Case, Court Lists Down Relaxations For Pushpa 2 Actor - News18
item.description:
Allu Arjun Gets BIG Relief In Fan's Death Case

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: News18

Allu Arjun received significant legal relaxations in connection with the Pushpa 2 stampede case, alleviating some conditions previously imposed on him after his arrest last month.

  • Allu Arjun was arrested in relation to a stampede incident that occurred at the Pushpa 2 premiere, which resulted in a woman's death and injuries to a child.
  • The Nampally court has exempted him from appearing at the Chikkadapally police station every Sunday for security reasons.
  • He has also been granted permission to travel abroad.

"The crowd went out of control after Allu Arjun stepped out of his car to greet fans attending the premiere," stated a source close to the incident.

This legal development comes after Allu Arjun was previously remanded to judicial custody and then granted interim bail.

item.title: ‘Tiku Talsania is doing well and is under observation after falling ill’: Rashami Desai - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rashami Desai Provides Update on Tiku Talsania's Health After Hospitalization

Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

After attending a film screening in Mumbai, actor Tiku Talsania fell ill and is now hospitalized. Rashami Desai, who met him shortly before he fell ill, provided an update on his condition.

  • Tiku Talsania experienced discomfort at a film screening and was hospitalized.
  • Rashami Desai stated that he is under observation and in a better space surrounded by loved ones.
  • Initial reports suggested a heart attack, but it was clarified that he suffered a brain stroke.
  • Tiku is known for roles in various popular films, predominantly in comedic roles.
“He was fine when I met him... He is under observation at the moment,” - Rashami Desai.

This incident highlights the sudden health issues that can arise, and fans are encouraged to pray for Tiku’s speedy recovery.

item.title: No more actions on derivatives on anvil: Sebi's Ananth Narayan - Moneycontrol
item.description:
No More Actions on Derivatives: Insights from Sebi's Ananth Narayan

Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is not planning any additional restrictions on derivatives, according to Sebi's Wholetime Member Ananth Narayan. Sebi is focusing on improving the system without further constraints.

  • Sebi assures that no further actions will be taken against derivatives trading.
  • An expert group is working on measures to enhance business practices and risk management in the derivatives market.
  • Recent restrictions imposed in November aimed at curbing speculative trades after poor performance data for retail investors.
  • Discussions within Sebi include measures to improve risk assessment in the derivatives market.
“At this point in time, there is no thought of Sebi taking any further steps in this particular regard.” - Ananth Narayan

This stance demonstrates Sebi's commitment to maintain the integrity and trust of the derivatives market while exploring avenues for enhancements.

item.title: India's Champions Trophy And England Series Squad Live: BCCI To Take Drastic Step Over Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj? - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India's Champions Trophy 2025 And England Series Squad Announcement Live

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The deadline for the squad selection for the Champions Trophy and the England white-ball series is fast approaching. India has requested an extension to submit the provisional squad, which needs to be finalized by February 12.

  • The BCCI selection committee, led by Ajit Agarkar, will announce the squads soon.
  • Following a disappointing performance against Australia, significant changes are likely.
  • Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are expected to be included in the teams.
  • Mohammed Siraj and Jasprit Bumrah may not play in the T20Is but are expected to return for the ODIs.
  • KL Rahul's participation remains uncertain as he might be rested.
“Will the squad be announced today? Fans are eagerly awaiting the decisions from the selection committee.”

The live updates provide insights into the anticipated squad application and player conditions, with several players' fitness under scrutiny.

item.title: Sierra Leone Reports First Case Of Mpox - Barron's
item.description:
Sierra Leone Reports First Case Of Mpox

Date: January 10, 2024 | Source: AFP

Sierra Leone has reported its first confirmed case of mpox, a potentially deadly viral disease. The patient is a 27-year-old man from a rural district near Freetown, with health authorities actively tracing contacts to prevent further spread.

  • The patient confirmed positive on January 10, 2024.
  • Mpox is related to the smallpox virus and manifests through fever and skin lesions.
  • The disease was first identified in 1970 in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
  • Health authorities have activated a swift response, isolating the patient and monitoring contacts for 21 days.
  • A public awareness campaign is underway, and health workers are receiving protective equipment and training.
“Health teams are actively tracing and investigating to identify potential exposed persons and to prevent further spread.”

Sierra Leone's experience with Ebola informs their rapid response efforts to contain the mpox outbreak.
